title: BostonU Trojan Detection Container.
technique: BostonU XGBoost Regressor w/ attribution features
technique_description:
Given a pdf feature input and a model, we use attribution (= input  * gradient of the loss w.r.t input) as the features for trojan detection. 
  							If there exists n pdf feature inputs, a model can produce n attribution features. The detector will make n predictions. The mean of the prediction will be used as the final prediction.
  							The trojan detector is a xgboost regressor. Hyperparameter tuning and k-folds are adopted to find the best hyperparameters

train_data_augmentation.description: The times that the data are repeatedly processed.
